name: Amara Resort & Spa, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was perfect because it was within walking distance of shops and restaurants and close to Slide Rock and numerous trailheads. They also have a free shuttle that will take you anywhere you want to go within a certain distance of the hotel. Their pool and courtyard areas with the beautiful view were our favorite places to hang out. In the evening they offered free wine in the lobby and there was a pianist playing out in the courtyard. It is a pet friendly hotel, (we do not have pets) but there was no evidence such as smell or fur anywhere so their housekeeping staff must do a wonderful job ensuring all areas are cleaned thoroughly. All the staff were very friendly, greeting and visiting with us each time we came through the lobby. We would definitely stay there again and strongly recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Excellent location and great amenities

reviews.text: Very relaxing hotel. The staff was very friendly, loved the pool area and view, and the live music at night with the open fire pits isn't something you get at many hotels. My 11 and 16 year old kids thought this was a pretty cool hotel too. I would definitely recommend. The water control in the shower is confusing to use and free wifi in rooms would be a nice addition
reviews.title: Family enjoyed everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I picked the Amara by much research prior to booking the Hotel. I can tell you, my hard work and research paid off! It was a rough year, with me beating breast cancer and both of us being hit hard with Hurricane Sandy, we just wanted to get away and forget all those hard moments. Choosing the Amara was spot on! The hotel, now benefiting from becoming part of the Kimpton Family is an amazing resort, beautifully appointed, manicured just right; yet understated in elegance and class.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort, amazing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was the best "feel good" vacation that we have had in many, many years. Thanks in part to Benjamin, Joey, Teah, Jennifer, Lauren, Imelda, Barbara, and many others whose names are too numerous to list.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived home, I called the Hotel and booked another 8 day stay next June. I spoke with Jennifer and told her how much we enjoyed the Amara experience.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service!

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay...but have to say they don't meets your needs when you call front desk gor service. Honestly, request some simple like toilet paper and 1 1/2 hrs later still didn't show up...had to go find some on a housekeeping cart. That is what I will take with me as a reminder of customer service. Shame shame!! The guys in the parking area were excellent!
reviews.title: Beautiful place...not so great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has recently been taken over by the Kimpton property line and they have once again turned an average hotel into a true gem. It begins with the valet/bellman that greet you upon arrival and assist you to the front desk for check-in, might I add that the lobby is very fresh and inviting with the recent remodel. We dined at the resturant for lunch and dinner and all of the wait staff were very friendly and accommodating. The Amara resort is on its way to becoming one of the most popular places to stay in Sedona from my opinion. The last time we were in Sedona we stayed at the Enchantment resort which turned out to be nothing more than a well maketed dud in our eyes, we would reccomend to anyone the Amara resort over the Enchantment resort. For us its all about service quality, property condition and attention to detail and they nailed all three. The most important benefit for us is that they are BEYOND pet friendly and since we don't travel without our pet we are able to stay somewhere that doesn't make you feel unwanted. At this point we feel spoiled and will not give our business to any other property line, we hope they continue to grow as it's always refreshing to be able to visit somewhere new. Well done Amara staff you have earned a repeat customer.
reviews.title: Another Kimpton Success!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for two nights at the newly rejuvenated Amara Kimpton resort July 4 & July 5.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was planning a trip to Arizona/Grand Canyon when I received an email as a Kimpton Member alerting me to the newly refurbished resort. I was excited as my previous stays with Kimpton have been extraordinarily memorable (Seattle and DC).
reviews.title: Short July Stay

reviews.text: I have to agree with chadz78 - the resort and its location in uptown Sedona is nice, making it walkable to restaurants. The room (101) I stayed in was an accessibility room (why? I never requested for it), was barely average with a view of a wall, and a painful showerhead designed to point only at some one sitting down. When I checked-in, of course I didn't see the shower :( The next morning, on my way out, I asked the front desk to fix the showerhead so I wouldn't have to perform any aerobics to just get a shower. Late that night when we returned from our day trip, I discovered it wasn't fixed. Exhausted, I gave up.
reviews.title: Little things = huge benefits

reviews.text: We stayed at the beginning of July. It was everything we expected and more. The room was great - we requested a ground floor room on the courtyard and that's what we got. Everyone was friendly and helpful, the views were fantastic, the service was top rate and the kids loved the pool. We never had a problem with finding a spot to sit at the pool.The food was excellent and the free wine and music outside at night were a nice touch. We will definately be back.
reviews.title: First Class Food and Service
Not as expected - strange layout
reviews.text: I would agree with other reviewers that this isn't really a resort. It feels more like an updated motel with a small pool and it really doesn't feel like other Kimptons I've stayed in - more like a sub-brand.

What I realized is a good number of the rooms have really no view at all - you may have a balcony but facing a huge tree - and that's an "upgraded" room. Or a window from the room next door might look right your room!The pool situation is very cramped and we didn't even get any pool time because of it. Those are fundamental problems that can't really be changed so it's hard to give this place high marks.
reviews.title: Nice Location and Good Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food (three different meals) however was outstanding and I wouldn't recommend leaving the property to eat because you'll find nothing better. And the staff we encountered were all exceptionally friendly.
reviews.title: Great intimate resort!

reviews.text: One gripe: two female hotel "executives" were having lunch next to us talking about the property. Not sure their roles but they really need to move around the hotel more because the bottled water sitting out in 120 degree sune for hours leeching BPA and everything else is just poor management.
reviews.title: Very nice overall with some room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is dated, but much of Sedona is dated. There are few true luxury properties in Sedona and this is not one of them. It IS a solid 3 star hotel. If you go n expecting that you will be very pleased. If you come to Sedona looking for a budget you will stay in a dive. The Amara resort is comfortable and has nice amenities like valet parking, room service, wifi, a great pool. It is also right on Oak Creek which is nice. We stayed in room 256 which was literally over the creek.
reviews.title: They are trying

reviews.text: So I start out with the negative just so that you can decide for yourself if its important to you or not. The bed was SUPER hard and uncomfortable. I didn't get one good nights sleep in the three nights my husband and I stayed. Also the pillows are so soft that they go flat as soon as you put your head on it. We both had to used three pillows a piece just to make it work. That being said, the hotel and grounds are gorgeous! The rooms are spacious and pretty, the hot tub and pool is awesome, they serve complimentary wine and sangria in the lobby at night and also have a guest singer on the patio each night! Its wonderful! I just wish I slept better while I was there :(
reviews.title: Beds need work

reviews.text: I have now stayed with the Amara twice. Once with prior ownership and most recently with Kimpton being the new management. I was pleased both times and did notice some changes for the better of course. The staff at Amara is kind, helpful and authentic. Amara is an elegant establishment with a solid personality throughout the staff. Benjamin's staff with the dining are hard-working and pleasant folks. Ben was very attentive and helped me with anything I was looking for in and around Sedona. He is a great manager and wonderful host to guests and his staff. Joseph the valet gentlemen was always friendly especially during my last stay which was the hottest weekend in Sedona. He always was smiling and friendly. He was helpful on my departure out back to Chicago as I need directions and advice to take the back way through Prescott and Jerome for one last adventure and he was 'johnny on the spot'. The spa experience is wonderful and accomadating. I returned to have another massage from Jason, whom has just the right touch! He knows how to custom a massage for someone to relax after travel, work stress and still benefit the entire body.The Yoga instructors were so pleasant and made the day start off in a great way. Nice to meet other folks in the resort as well. Lastly, I had to return to hear an amazing man on the guitar, Anthony Mazzella. The Amara has just the man to play to many hearts to enjoy relaxing and fun original songs. Anthony always is pleasant to the guests and demonstrates his passion through his remarkable tunes. Overall, Amara has a spot in my heart for it is clean, elegant, well managed but most importantly has an authentic personality/vibe with the staff and the musicians they have creating an excellent experience for anyone to come and see for themselves.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, people, music and views!

reviews.text: Small hotel, small lobby, small rooms. Not sure if their AC was working, but they kept their lobby uncomfortably warm. The restaurant is also ridiculously expensive and refused to eat there. One lady at the front desk was impersonal and seemed disinterested. Do not count on their shuttle service. We called for pickup twice and still hadn't seen them, I decided to run down to the hotel and see what was up - the driver was just socializing with one of the front desk girls and just said, ' sorry- not sure what happened '. Idiots!
reviews.title: 4 circles really? More like a solid 3

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not recommend
reviews.title: Not quiet, not relaxing

description: The AAA Four-Diamond Amara Resort Hotel & Spa is a modern sanctuary that offers the best of all worlds. Ideally located in the Uptown area of America's most neautiful place, Sedona, Arizona. Welcome to the Amara Resort and Spa. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy the many recent enhancements to our property. All guest rooms include luxurious bed linens, robes, in room safes and refrigerators, in addition to a balcony offering spectacular views of the Sedona red rocks or our gardens. Enjoy in room dining or the sounds of live music at Hundred Rox, our indoor/outdoor three meal a day restaurant. Treat yourself to a massage or hot stone treatment at The Spa or sit by our infinity pool and soak in the spirit of Sedona and the Amara Resort and Spa.
